Next season, the Lakers will have a Big 3 — Here’s how it will happen
The Los Angeles Lakers are on the verge of forming a new 'Big 3' for next season, featuring LeBron James, Luka Doncic, and the emerging star, Austin Reaves. Reaves, who is showing significant growth, is expected to make his All-Star debut, solidifying the trio's status. He's currently averaging impressive numbers and has been pivotal for the Lakers, especially following Doncic's trade. As the team vies for a top playoff spot, the anticipation for next season grows, particularly with the All-Star festivities set to occur in Inglewood, California.
- Austin Reaves is averaging 19.6 points, 4.5 rebounds, and 6.0 assists per game this season.
- In his last four games, Reaves has averaged 30.8 points, 6.8 rebounds, and 7.0 assists on 52.9% shooting.
- The Lakers are competing for the No. 2 seed in the Western Conference.
- Reaves' development has positioned him as a vital component of the team as they head into the playoffs.
If Austin Reaves continues his upward trajectory, he is projected to surpass 20 points per game next season, enhancing the Lakers' potential as a championship contender. The hype for the All-Star festivities will serve as a platform for the new Big 3 to showcase their skills.
Bottom LineThe Lakers are primed for a promising future with a potentially dominant trio. The synergy between James, Doncic, and Reaves is expected to re-energize the franchise, making them a formidable opponent in the league.
